admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The draft land acquisition plan for the
            Azerbaijan Highway Project delineates the resettlement
            effect of the Tovuz bypass. The Tovuz bypass is a section of
            the existing east-west corridor between Baku and Tbilisi. It
            is approximately 10.5 km long. The proposed bypass road will
            have two lanes now (first phase), but will be widened in the
            future to a 4-lane-road (second phase).  The land
            acquisition in question will be done for both the first and
            second phases. The number of property owners/farmers losing
            land is exactly 399. Almost all of them lose less than 30
            percent of their land. The number of farmers losing 30
            percent or more of their land will be determined at the
            public consultation that will be held in September 2005.
            There is only one project-affected person (PAP) with a
            building - a garage - which has to be demolished or moved
            away. PAP in all categories are entitled to full
            compensation for their loss. The farmers will either get
            full money compensation or alternative land, where possible.
            Land swap (alternative land) is possible according to
            Azerbaijan legislation. The local authorities do not have
            enough land reserve to be used as alternative land. On the
            other hand the quality of the alternative land is much lower
            than the land owned by people. Therefore money compensation
            is preferred. In cases where more than 80 percent of a
            farmer's land is expropriated, the government will also
            buy the remaining 20 percent with full compensation.
